alert.note: Alert for Bell; Clay; Harlan; Knox; Leslie; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 11:30PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Harlan, northeastern Bell, northeastern Knox, Leslie, south central Perry and southeastern Clay Counties through MIDNIGHT EDT... At 1129 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hammond, or 9 miles northeast of Barbourville, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Brightshade, Mills, Erose, Lipps and Field around 1135 PM EDT. Ashers Fork, Ice Cliff, Gardner, Beverly and Plank around 1140 PM EDT. Roark, Queendale, Skidmore, Spring Creek, Warbranch, Creekville, Sandy Fork and Spruce Pine around 1145 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Asher, Mozelle, Essie, Hoskinston, Stinnett, Hosea, Hyden, Chappell, Wendover, Napier, Cutshin, Yeaddiss, Big Fork, Causey, Cinda, Big Rock, Daley, Smilax, Leatherwood and Frew. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Bell; Clay; Harlan; Knox; Leslie; Perry
